    • Method Detail

      • collectionPrinter

        public static <T> java.lang.String collectionPrinter(char orderType,
                                                     java.util.ArrayList<T> collection)
        Orders the objects in an array with an index for each. \nUsed for giving the user options.
        Type Parameters:
        T - String or objects with overriden toString(), ready to be presented.
        Parameters:
        orderType - Ids the type of index as a char. S for string, 0 to start with 0, 1 to start with 1
        collection - The arrayList with the collection of strings or objects with overriden toString().
        Returns:
        A String with the formatted and indexed list of items in the collection, ready to be print.\nReturns null if the input is not one of the possible choices.

      • printMap

        public static java.lang.String printMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> userQuizzes)
        A string of the inputted map with identation of the children arrays.
        Parameters:
        userQuizzes - the map to print
        Returns:
        the String of the structured map.

      • compareTwoArrays

        public static boolean compareTwoArrays(java.lang.String[] actualKeys,
                                       java.lang.String[] expectedKeys)
        Compares two unordered arrays for matches.
        Parameters:
        actualKeys - set of keys to match
        expectedKeys - other set of keys to match against
        Returns:
        true if all args match, false if not.

      • arrayContains

        public static boolean arrayContains(java.lang.String toCheck,
                                    java.lang.String[] stringArray)
        Checks if a string[] contains a specified string
        Parameters:
        toCheck - String to be checked.
        stringArray - Array to check if the requested String is inside of.
        Returns:
        True if array contains toCheck. false otherwise.

      • addElementToArray

        public static java.lang.String[] addElementToArray(java.lang.String toAdd,
                                                   java.lang.String[] targetArray)
        adds a single string into an existing, shorter String[] type
        Parameters:
        toAdd - String to input into the array.
        targetArray - array to add the string to.
        Returns:
        extended version of the targetArray with the new String added to the end.

      • toArrayList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> toArrayList(java.lang.String[] targetArray)
        transforms a String[] into an Arraylist. (made redundant by method addALL(), but dependent)
        Parameters:
        targetArray - the array to be turned into an ArrayList
        Returns:
        resolved ArrayList from the inputed String[].

        Returns an array without the falgged string.
        Parameters:
